ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I mix up ''he'', ''she'', ''it'' and ''they''. For example, I might say ''he'' when talking about a girl.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I leave out sounds in words. For example, I might say ''paying'' for ''playing'' or ''amblance'' for ''ambulance''.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I feel anxious when I am with other people.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I make false starts or search for the right word. For example, I might say ''do you- do you- do you want to go- want to go to the cinema?''
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I am told that I keep talking about things that others are not interested in.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I forget words I know- for example, instead of ''rhinoceros'' I may say ''that animal with the horn on its nose''
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People tell me I do not listen to what they say.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People say that my face looks blank when I should look angry, scared or excited.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: When I have free time I choose the same favorite activity (for example, watching the same TV program or searching for the same thing on the internet).
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People find it hard to follow what I am talking about
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I copy what other people say
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I mix up similar words. I might say ''elephant'' for ''rhino'' or ''microscope'' for ''telescope''.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: Other people make fun of me or pick on me.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I don't look at people when I am talking to them.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I don't understand other people's jokes.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: Other people leave me out of activities.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I mix up words like ''he'' and ''him''. For example, I might say ''him is working'' instead of ''he is working''
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I start sentences with the same words, such as ''all of a sudden'', ''actually'' or ''you'll never guess''.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I get confused when a word is used with a different meaning; for example, if someone says ''stick that down over there'' I might think they want me to glue it down rather than just put it down.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I am told that I stand too near to people when I talk to them.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I start talking to people I don't know, like people on the train/bus or people in a shop.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I like to talk about lists of things I have memorized, like football teams, capital cities, weather charts, etc.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People tell me I talk with an unusual accent or ''talk like people on television''.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People say I don't pronounce some words properly. For example, saying ''bokle'' for bottle.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People say it's hard to tell if I'm talking about something real or pretend.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People tell me that I change the conversation to what interests me.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I use short sentences. I might say ''TV on'' instead of ''can we have the TV on''.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I find it hard to express myself in a group of people.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I lead off the beginning or endings of words (for example, ''puter'' for ''computer'' or ''lie'' for ''light'').
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People tell me I repeat back what they say to me
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People tell me I ignore them when they talk to me.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I mix up words which sound similar. I might say ''telephone'' for ''television'' or ''magician'' for ''musician''.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I hurt or upset people without meaning to.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I mishear what people say. For example, if someone says we'll go to the cinema next week, I might think it was tomorrow
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People tell me I talk too much.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I leave off word endings. For example, I might say ''I play football last night; instead of ''I played football last night''.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People say I tell them things I already know.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I make mistakes saying long words. For example, I might say ''dictree'' for ''dictionary''.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I find it hard to know when people are upset or annoyed.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I find it difficult to talk about past events. For example, I get mixed up when I try to explain a film that I have just seen.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People laugh at things I saw when I don't meant to be funny.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I give people detailed information when a more general comment would be find. For example, if I just met someone and he asked me ''where do you live?'', I would give my full address rather than just my town or region.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People tell me I don't use proper sentences.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I mispronounce words. For example, ''chimley'' for ''chimney'' or ''wabbit'' for ''rabbit''.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People tell me that I ask the same question over and over.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I use words like ''thing'' and ''it'', and people don't know what I am talking about.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I am interested in things that other people don't notice (for example, electric sockets, lamp-posts).
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: When I am describing something, people ask me to explain what I mean all over again.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People are surprised because I use unusual words.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People find it hard to understand what I am talking about.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I speak clearly.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: When someone suggests I take part in a new activity I look forward to doing it
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I talk clearly about my future plans (for example, when I plan to do at the weekend).
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I understand when people are being sarcastic. For example, I would know it was a joke if someone said ''A lovely day!'' when it was pouring with rain.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I talk in long and complicated sentences such as: ''When we went to the tennis match, I saw this friend of my brother standing on the corner''.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: When I talk, I use my hands to help get my meaning across.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I am concerned when other people are upset.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I speak clearly and easily.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I am quiet when other people are trying to talk or concentrate. For example, if someone is watching TV or on the phone.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I am polite to other people. For example, if I were given a present that I didn't like, I would say ''thank you''; or if someone looked odd I would keep quiet rather than making a comment.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: When answering questions, I give enough information without being too detailed.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: People like talking to me.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I am okay when unexpected things happen. For example, I would keep calm if I planned to work on a computer but couldn't because it wasn't working.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I use abstract words; for example, ideas and concepts such as ''knowledge'', ''politics''. ''courage'' and ''judgement''.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I find it easy to smile when talking to people.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I use words that refer to categories; for example, words like ''furniture'' for ''chairs and table'' or ''fruit'' for ''oranges and bananas''.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I talk about my friends and am interested in what they do and say.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I can explain a past event clearly, like what happened during my day or at the weekend.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I use sentences with words like ''because'' and ''so'' (for example, ''Michael bought himself another ticket so he could take his friend to the match'').
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: I talk to people about their interests instead of my own.
Notes: 0 = Less than one a week (or never); 1 = About once a week; 2 = Once or twice a day; 3 = Several times a day (or all the time); -9 = Missing value
